div2.head: Novel
div2.bibl: The Precipice: A Novel. Boston: Houghton Mifflin, 1914; Urbana: U of Illinois P, 1989. http://www.gutenberg.org/etext/12177

div2.head: Autobiography
div2.bibl: Painted Windows. New York: George H. Doran, 1918. also http://www.gutenberg.org/etext/1875

div2.head: Short Stories
div2.bibl: "The Man at the Edge of Things." Atlantic Monthly 84 (Sept. 1899): 321-342.
"Rubaiyat and the Liner." Harper's Bazaar 33 (29 Sept. 1900): 1360-1366.

div2.head: Poems
div2.bibl: "On a Blank Leaf in 'The Marble Faun.'" Century Magazine 42 (Oct. 1891): 847.

div2.head: Essays
div2.bibl: "The Artistic Side of Chicago." Atlantic Monthly 84 (Dec. 1899): 828-834.
"A Defense of Fine Writing." The Critic 42 (June 1903): 546-547.

div2.head: Book Reviews
div2.bibl:
A Mountain Woman. Chicago: Way & Williams, 1896; Freeport, NY: Books for Libraries, 1969.
Reviewed in: The Bookman 3 (July 1896): 460; Chicago Tribune (6 June 1896): 10; Critic 29 (8 Aug. 1896): 88; The Dial 22 (1 Jan. 1897): 23; The Nation 63 (10 Sept. 1896): 201.

The Shape of Fear, and Other Ghostly Tales. New York: Macmillan, 1898; 1899; 1904; Freeport, NY: Books for Libraries, 1969
Reviewed in: Atlantic Monthly 83 (Feb. 1899): 287-288; The Bookman 8 (Jan. 1899): 492; Reader (1904): 455; The Spectator; The Bookman 8 (Dec. 1898) http://etext.lib.virginia.edu/etcbin/browse-mixed-new?id=AnoPeat&tag=public&images=images/modeng&data=/texts/english/modeng/parsed

The Beleaguered Forest. New York: D. Appleton, 1901.
Reviewed in: Critic 24 (Sept. 1901): 263.

Poems You Ought to Know, Selected by E. W. Peattie. Chicago: Jamieson-Higgins, 1902; Chicago: Fleming H. Revell, 1903; Freeport, NY: Books for Libraries, 1969; Granger Book Co., 1978.
Reviewed in: Critic.

The Edge of Things. Chicago: F.H. Revell, 1903.
Reviewed in The Bookman 18 (Nov. 1903). http://etext.lib.virginia.edu/etcbin/browse-mixed-new?id=CooEdge&tag=public&images=images/modeng&data=/texts/english/modeng/parsed

div2.head: Movie
div2.bibl: The 1925 film Thunder Mountain is based on the play "Thunder" or "Howdy Folks" by Pearl Franklin, which was based on a Peattie's Azalea Young Adult fiction series.

Actors in "Thunder Mountain"
Madge Bellamy
http://www.goldensilents.com/stars/madgebellamy.html
Zasu Pitts
http://www.goldensilents.com/stars/zasupitts.html

div1.head: References

Matthiessen, F.O. The James Family. New York: Random House, 1947.
Wilson, Christopher P. The Labor of Words: Literary Professionalism in the Progressive Era. Athens: University of Georgia Press, 1985.
